results.title: Prepregnancy Polycystic Ovary Syndrome as a Risk Factor of Subsequent Preterm Labor: A National Population-Based Cohort Study
results.journal: Int J Environ Res Public Health
results.text_hl: The risk of subsequent @<m>DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Premature</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007752 @@@preterm labor@@@ was reduced by about 10% for the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ subgroup compared with the non-@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ subgroup.

citations.NLM: Pan ML, Chen LR, Chen KH. Prepregnancy Polycystic Ovary Syndrome as a Risk Factor of Subsequent Preterm Labor: A National Population-Based Cohort Study Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2022 Apr 30;19(9):. PMID: 35564864
citations.BibTeX: @article{35564864, title={Prepregnancy Polycystic Ovary Syndrome as a Risk Factor of Subsequent Preterm Labor: A National Population-Based Cohort Study}, author={Pan ML and Chen LR and Chen KH}, journal={Int J Environ Res Public Health}, volume={19}, number={9}}

results.title: Effects of metformin use in pregnant patients with polycystic ovary syndrome
results.text_hl: The study found that the group, which continued @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use throughout the entire pregnancy, had diminished incidences of @DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@fetal growth restriction@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Premature</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007752 @@@preterm labor@@@, and increased live birth rates.

citations.NLM: Kumar P, Khan K. Effects of metformin use in pregnant patients with polycystic ovary syndrome J Hum Reprod Sci. 2012 May;5(2):166-9. PMID: 23162354
citations.BibTeX: @article{23162354, title={Effects of metformin use in pregnant patients with polycystic ovary syndrome}, author={Kumar P and Khan K}, journal={J Hum Reprod Sci}, volume={5}, number={2}, pages={166-9}}

results.title: Effects of metformin on pregnancy outcomes in women with polycystic ovary syndrome
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ throughout pregnancy could increase the possibility of term delivery, @DISEASE_Vaginitis @DISEASE_MESH:D014627 @@@VD@@@ and reduce the risk of @DISEASE_Abortion_Spontaneous @DISEASE_MESH:D000022 @@@EPL@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Premature</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007752 @@@preterm labor@@@, pregnancy complications such as @DISEASE_Diabetes_Gestational @DISEASE_MESH:D016640 @@@GDM@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension_Pregnancy_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D046110 @@@PIH@@@, with no serious side effects.

citations.NLM: Zeng XL, Zhang YF, Tian Q, Xue Y, An RF. Effects of metformin on pregnancy outcomes in women with polycystic ovary syndrome Medicine (Baltimore). 2016 Sep;95(36):e4526. PMID: 27603343
citations.BibTeX: @article{27603343, title={Effects of metformin on pregnancy outcomes in women with polycystic ovary syndrome}, author={Zeng XL and Zhang YF and Tian Q and Xue Y and An RF}, journal={Medicine (Baltimore)}, volume={95}, number={36}, pages={e4526}}

results.title: Triplet pregnancy after metformin in a woman with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: RESULT(S): Pregnancy developed up to @<m>DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Premature</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007752 @@@premature labor@@@ at 31 weeks.

citations.NLM: Clapauch R, Mattos TM. Triplet pregnancy after metformin in a woman with polycystic ovary syndrome. Fertil Steril. 2008 May;89(5):1260.e1-1260.e2. PMID: 17628554
citations.BibTeX: @article{17628554, title={Triplet pregnancy after metformin in a woman with polycystic ovary syndrome.}, author={Clapauch R and Mattos TM}, journal={Fertil Steril}, volume={89}, number={5}, pages={1260.e1-1260.e2}}

results.title: Efficacy and safety of metformin during pregnancy in women with gestational diabetes mellitus or polycystic ovary syndrome: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: The use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ throughout pregnancy in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@ reduces the rates of early @DISEASE_Abortion_Spontaneous @DISEASE_MESH:D000022 @@@pregnancy loss@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Premature</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007752 @@@preterm labor@@@ and protects against fetal @DISEASE_Fetal_Growth_Retardation @DISEASE_MESH:D005317 @@@growth restriction@@@.

citations.NLM: Lautatzis ME, Goulis DG, Vrontakis M. Efficacy and safety of metformin during pregnancy in women with gestational diabetes mellitus or polycystic ovary syndrome: a systematic review. Metabolism. 2013 Nov;62(11):1522-34. PMID: 23886298
citations.BibTeX: @article{23886298, title={Efficacy and safety of metformin during pregnancy in women with gestational diabetes mellitus or polycystic ovary syndrome: a systematic review.}, author={Lautatzis ME and Goulis DG and Vrontakis M}, journal={Metabolism}, volume={62}, number={11}, pages={1522-34}}

results.title: Polycystic ovarian syndrome and pregnancy outcome.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ seem to experience increased risk of cesarean delivery while their newborns face increased perinatal morbidity and mortality. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ use seems to reduce the risk of @DISEASE_Obstetric_Labor_Complications @DISEASE_MESH:D007744 @@@obstetrical complications@@@; however, prospective studies are necessary on the field.

citations.NLM: Iavazzo C, Vitoratos N. Polycystic ovarian syndrome and pregnancy outcome. Arch Gynecol Obstet. 2010 Sep;282(3):235-9. PMID: 20458488
citations.BibTeX: @article{20458488, title={Polycystic ovarian syndrome and pregnancy outcome.}, author={Iavazzo C and Vitoratos N}, journal={Arch Gynecol Obstet}, volume={282}, number={3}, pages={235-9}}
